result.execSummary:
The defendant Gaspar Sanchez-Amayo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Time served sentence with Good Time credit and credit for prior time served.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gaspar Sanchez-Amayo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:28 PM: Defendant Gaspar Sanchez-Amayo in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.  Per ADA:  Notes for the record that he does not believe that Def has obtained counsel yet.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel issue.  Statement by Def:  Did contact SPD office for counsel but has still not spoken with SPD attorney.  Def requests that matter go forward today without counsel.  Def will enter NC plea today to both counts.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1: NC   Plea Ct 2:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Argument by ADA as to penalty.  Calculates 33 days TS credit - argues for WCJ.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts recommendation of the State and imposes 44 days WCJ each count with concurrent terms.  33 days TS credit with GT - equates to a time served sentence.  Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  60 DTP or PP.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 3:48 PM: Defendant Gaspar Sanchez-Amayo in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karyn Simmons also present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.  Court questions Defendant as to status of counsel.  Def has not contacted SPD on his own.  Def states he was not aware of the procedure.  Court again explains the procedure to notify jail staff that he wants to speak with SPD on eligibility.  Court will expect that by the next hearing the Defendant has spoken with SPD.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case Called @ 4:25 PM: Defendant Gaspar Sanchez-Amayo in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Intepreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.  Per ADA:  It is believed the matter is resolved, however, Interpreter services were required.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not know how to get an attorney and has not spoken to SPD.  Def is referred to SPD for eligibility.  P/S again adjourned - Defendant is to speak with SPD on eligibility.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.
Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:28 p.m. Defendant Gaspar Sanchez-Amayo in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant waives his right to counsel and wishes to enter a plea. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. The court accepts a waiver to the right to personal appearance.  The Court does not wish to proceed without the assistance of the spanish interpreter. NG plea entered. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Cash Bond. No statement by the DE regarding bond. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
